Performs a single step in the environment.

Parameters:

  • player_id (int) – The ID of the player taking the action.

  • action (str) – The action to be taken by the player.

Returns:

  • done (bool): Whether the episode has concluded

  • info (Dict[str, Any]): Additional information about the environment.

TODO

class textarena.core.Env[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for text-based game environments.

This class outlines the interface for the environment, including methods for resetting the environment, stepping through the environment (taking actions), and rendering the environment state.

close()[source]¶
game_state: State¶
get_observation()[source]¶
abstract reset(seed: int | None = None)[source]¶

Resets the environment to an initial state.

Parameters:

  • observations (Optional[Dict[int, str]]) – Initial observations for the players.

  • seed (Optional[int]) – Seed for the random number generator to ensure reproducibility.

Returns:

Depending on implementation, should return initial observations and any additional info.

Respond to the player’s action (e.g., question in “20 Questions”) based on the game’s state.

The game master’s response.

class textarena.core.State(num_players: int, max_turns: int | None = None, role_mapping: Dict[int, str] | None = {}, check_truncated: bool | None = True)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to manage the state of the game, including observations, rewards, and some game logic.

add_log(from_id: int, message: str)[source]¶

TODO

add_observation(from_id: int, to_id: int, message: str, for_logging: bool = True)[source]¶

Add an observation message to the observations and logs.

Parameters:

  • from_id (int) – The ID of the sender (player or game).

  • to_id (int) – The ID of the receiver (-1 for all players).

  • message (str) – The message content.

  • for_logging (bool) – If True, the message is added to the logs.

close()[source]¶
reset(game_state: Dict[str, Any], player_prompt_function: Callable, executable_on_reset: List[Callable] | None = None)[source]¶

Reset the game state.

Parameters:

game_state (Dict[str, Any]) – Initial game state to be set.

set_draw(reason: str | None)[source]¶

Declare the game as a draw.

Parameters:

reason (Optional[str]) – Reason for the draw.

set_invalid_move(player_ids: List[int], reasons: List[str] | None)[source]¶

Handle an invalid move made by a player.

Parameters:

  • player_ids (List[int]) – List of player IDs who made an invalid move.

  • reason (Optional[str]) – Reason for the invalid move.

set_winners(player_ids: List[int], reason: str | None)[source]¶

Set the winners of the game.

Parameters:

  • player_ids (List[int]) – List of player IDs who have won.

  • reason (Optional[str]) – Reason for winning.

step(rotate_player: bool = True)[source]¶

Advance the game state by one turn.

Parameters:

rotate_player (bool) – Whether to rotate the current player after the step.

Returns:

Tuple[

bool, # done Dict[str, Any], # info

]: The updated game state after the step.

textarena.utils module¶

Utilities used across games and environments. Expect functionality to be spun off into separate modules in the future.

textarena.utils.batch_open_router_generate(texts: list[str], model_string: str, message_history: list[dict] | None, batch_size: int = 8, **gen_kwargs) → list[str][source]¶

Batched version of open_router_generate. Also wraps the async function in a synchronous function.

async textarena.utils.open_router_generate(text: str, model_string: str, message_history: list[dict] | None, **gen_kwargs) → str[source]¶

Generate a response from a model behind openrouter model.

class textarena.Env[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for text-based game environments.

This class outlines the interface for the environment, including methods for resetting the environment, stepping through the environment (taking actions), and rendering the environment state.

get_observation()[source]¶
abstract reset(seed: int | None = None)[source]¶

Resets the environment to an initial state.

Parameters:

  • observations (Optional[Dict[int, str]]) – Initial observations for the players.

  • seed (Optional[int]) – Seed for the random number generator to ensure reproducibility.

Returns:

Depending on implementation, should return initial observations and any additional info.

textarena.check_env_exists(env_id: str)[source]¶

Check if an environment exists in the registry.

textarena.find_highest_version(name: str)[source]¶

Find the highest registered version of an environment by its name.

textarena.make(env_id: str, **kwargs) → Any[source]¶

Create an environment instance using the registered ID.

textarena.make_online(env_id: str, model_name: str, model_token: str, queue_time_limit: float | None = None) → Tuple[OnlineEnv, int][source]¶

Join the matchmaking queue and wait until a match is found.

Parameters:

  • env_id (str) – Environment ID to join.

  • model_name (str) – Name of the model.

  • model_token (str) – Authentication token for the model.

  • queue_time_limit (Optional[float], optional) – Max time to wait in queue. Defaults to 300.

Returns:

Initialized online environment and player ID.

Return type:

Tuple[OnlineEnv, int]
